message_1: Suppose there is a system which has an event A occurring at time t=2 and an event B occurring at time t=5. Express the statement "A occurred before B" in temporal logic.
message_2:
In temporal logic, we can use the "Until" operator (denoted by 'U') to express that a certain event occurs before another event. In this case, we want to express that event A occurred before event B. We can represent the events A and B as propositions p and q, respectively.

The statement "A occurred before B" can be expressed in temporal logic as:

p U q
